partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title: PART 2 WHEN BOATS MEET
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: The rules of Part 2 apply between boats that are sailing in or near the racing area and intend to race, are racing, or have been racing. However, a boat not racing shall not be penalized for breaking one of these rules, except rule 14 when the incident resulted in injury or serious damage, or rule 23.1.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title: PART 2 WHEN BOATS MEET Continued
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: When a boat sailing under these rules meets a vessel that is not, she shall comply with the International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea (IRPCAS) or government right-of-way rules. If the notice of race so states, the rules of Part 2 are replaced by the right- of-way rules of the IRPCAS or by government right-of-way rules.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title: SECTION A RIGHT OF WAY Definition
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: A boat has right of way over another boat when the other boat is required to keep clear of her. However, some rules in Sections B, C and D limit the actions of a right-of-way boat.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title:
SECTION A RIGHT OF WAY
10 ON OPPOSITE TACKS
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: When boats are on opposite tacks, a port-tack boat shall keep clear of a starboard-tack boat.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title:
SECTION A RIGHT OF WAY
11 ON THE SAME TACK, OVERLAPPED
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: When boats are on the same tack and overlapped, a windward boat shall keep clear of a leeward boat.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title:
SECTION A RIGHT OF WAY
12 ON THE SAME TACK, NOT OVERLAPPED
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: When boats are on the same tack and not overlapped, a boat clear astern shall keep clear of a boat clear ahead.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Title:
SECTION A RIGHT OF WAY
13 WHILE TACKING
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionA.Rule: After a boat passes head to wind, she shall keep clear of other boats until she is on a close-hauled course. During that time rules 10, 11 and 12 do not apply. If two boats are subject to this rule at the same time, the one on the otherâ€™s port side or the one astern shall keep clear.
